snippet: Despite the French tradition of secularism, Bussy Saint-Georges is constructing an “Esplanade of Religions” to appeal to its new immigrants.
abstract: Bussy Saint-Georges Journal; 'Esplanade of the Religions' is under construction in Bussy Saint-Georges, French village that has grown into city populated by immigrants along with their diverse religious backgrounds; esplanade will include Roman Catholic church, mosque, synagogue and several Buddhist temples and has been hailed by United Nations as place of interfaith dialogue.
lead_paragraph: Despite the French tradition of secularism, Bussy Saint-Georges is constructing an “Esplanade of Religions” to appeal to its new immigrants.

headline.seo: Bussy Saint-Georges, France, Builds a Holy Quarter
headline.main: Bucking French Tradition, City Sets Up a Kind of Holy Quarter
headline.print_headline: Bucking French Tradition, City Sets Up a Kind of Holy Quarter
